v.v: Let me sing for my well beloved, a song of my beloved about his vineyard.
He spaded it, removed the stones, and planted it with an excellent kind of vine.

v: My well beloved had a vineyard on a very fertile hill.
He built a tower in the middle of it, and also built a winepress.
He waited for it to produce grapes, but it only produced wild grapes.

v.v: So now, inhabitant of Jerusalem and man of Judah,
What more could have been done for my vineyard, that I have not done for it?
Now I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard: I will remove the hedge,
I will lay it waste, and it will not be pruned nor hoed. Instead, briers and thorns will spring up.
For the vineyard of Yahweh of hosts is the house of Israel,

v: judge between me and my vineyard.
When I looked for it to produce grapes, why did it produce wild grapes?
I will turn it into a pasture, I will break down its wall, and it will be trampled down.
I will also command the clouds not to rain on it.
and the man of Judah his pleasant planting;
he waited for justice, but instead, there was killing; for righteousness, but, instead, a shout for help.

v.v: Woe to those who join house to house, who join field to field,
Yahweh of hosts told me,
For a ten-yoke vineyard will yield only one bath, and one homer of seed will yield only an ephah.
Woe to those who rise up early in the morning to obtain strong drink,
They banquet with harp, lute, tambourine, flute, and wine,

v: until no room remains, and you alone remain in the land!
many houses will be empty, even great and impressive ones, without any inhabitant.
those who linger late into the night until wine inflames them.
but they do not recognize the work of Yahweh, nor have they considered the doings of his hands.

v.v: Therefore my people have gone into captivity for lack of understanding;
Therefore Sheol has made its appetite greater and has opened its mouth very wide;
Man will be forced to bend down, and mankind will be humbled; the eyes of the lofty will be cast down.
Yahweh of hosts will be exalted in his justice, and God the Holy One will show himself holy by his righteousness.
Then the sheep will feed as in their own pasture, and in the ruins, lambs will graze as foreigners.

v: their honored leaders go hungry, and their common people have nothing to drink.
their elite, the people, their leaders, and the revelers and those who are happy among them, descend into Sheol.

v.v: Woe to those who pull along iniquity with useless cords and who pull along sin as if it were with a cart rope.
Woe to those who say, “Let God hurry, let him act quickly, so we can see it happen;
Woe to those who call evil good, and good evil;
Woe to those who are wise in their own eyes, and prudent in their own understanding!
Woe to those who are champions at drinking wine, and masters at mixing strong drinks;
who acquit the wicked for payment, and deprive the innocent of his rights!

v: and let the plans of the Holy One of Israel come, so that we may know them.”
who represent darkness as light, and light as darkness;
who represent bitter as sweet, and sweet as bitter!

v.v: Therefore as the tongue of fire devours stubble, and as the dry grass goes down in flame,
Therefore the anger of Yahweh is kindled against his people. He has reached out with his hand against them and has punished them.

v: so their root will rot, and their blossom will blow away like dust.
This will happen because they have rejected the law of Yahweh of hosts, and because they have despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
The mountains tremble, and their corpses are like garbage in the streets.
In all these things, his anger does not subside; instead, his hand is still stretched out.

v.v: He will lift up a signal flag for far away nations and will whistle for those at the end of the earth.
None tire or stumble among them; none slumbers or sleeps.
Their arrows are sharp and all their bows are bent;
Their roaring will be like a lion; they will roar like young lions.
On that day they will roar against the prey as the sea roars.

v: Look, they will come speedily and promptly.
Nor are their belts loose, or the thongs of their sandals broken.
their horses’ hooves are like flint, and their chariot wheels like storms.
They will growl and seize the prey and drag it away, with none to rescue.
If anyone looks over the land, he will see darkness and suffering; even the light will be made dark by the clouds.
